div.p:
Peccavi
- but not from anything so bad as
undervaluing abeing yr your great & constant
kindness to me and mine. It had
been settled that Lady Davy, my
girl & I were to go about this day
to Spain for a 3 or 4 months'
tour - but after we had begun to
rub up our Castilian vocably vocabulary
& even to think of trunks and
cases & mule saddles - behold
a little romance that had been
going on unsuspected by me
& perhaps hardly was suspected by
the hero or at least by the heroine
was suddenly refined by this
Spanish announcement and in
a few days' time I found it all

settled that our chateau On St Espagne
must make way for a home in
Charles Street Berkeley Square &
another in Fife! But, perhaps you
will understand me - I had been
so awfully vexed & mortified
about certain premature &
luckily falsified announcements
of autumn 1846 that I was
determined not to make any
announcements at all on this
occasion & in fact I never
quite convinced myself that
the thing was certain until
I signed the contract. It was
all done in railway time
- but no matter - the acquaintance
had been gradual & the feeling

was sincere & deep & on both sides
I am satisfied well bestowed.
so let us hear no more about my
foolish silence. Moreover, I
was far from well & the row
of eating & drinking thro' through a
new tribe & troup can & &c
really bothered me out of half
my wits. Charlotte has
been there 8 days the wife of
a highly distinguished man
- exceedingly loved in his family
& unusually admired in
Society, - & considered as having
every chance of the very highest
honours in his profession. Tho' Though
only 35, he has already laid by
a sufficient independence - his
practice is very great

- his connections natural & acquired
of the most respectable kind. To
conclude he is a handsome fellow
- and Lady Davy hardly yet
forgives us for having seized
on her favourite Cavalier.
They are now at the D. of
Buccleuch's pretty villa at
Richmond & move thence in
a few days towards and Scotland. Mr
Hopes elder brother having two
places, he rents one of them
( Rankeillor , near Cupar, Fife)
& is much attached to it. His
business being chiefly that of
a Parliamentary Counsel he can
be there near 6 months in the
year - & there I hope to visit
them presently

I have already dined twice w with them
in their retreat & if they be not
most happy they are the cleverest
of actors. In a word I have
every reason to be satisfied &
gratified & I believe there
really is not a father in London
of almost any rank who
wd
would not have been glad indeed
to bestow his daughter on
James Hope. My boy is
now Walter Lockhart Scott
Lieut' Lieutenant
in the 16th Lancers at Brighton
& I think doing well since
he was indulged w with the cloth
of his choice. Thus you see
my domestic cares are

much lightened - for the present at
all events. I suppose Childrens
Children will by & bye come
to provide new objects of concern
& interest.

As soon as I am well enough to
work as usual I must now
begin the almost of the
Life of Sir W. S. Your
suggestions on that head
are laid by as valuable
guidance when I do come
to the job and if you can
add to the numbers with
the kind frankness that
belongs to your most

thankfully shall I endeavour to
profit by such advice as yours
is ever sure to be

Lady Scott is I believe living
alone at Portobello near
Edinburgh - I say I believe for
it is most difficult to extract
a note from her once in 2
months. Her Mother & Sir W
Ferguson had taken old
Hintly Birr on again in the
view of being near her & her
poor husband at Abbotsford
& there they are - but she
cd not, when I heard last,
make up her mind to revisit
Tweedside. It is possible that
she may now

have made the effort. Where she
is ultimately to free herself I
cannot say - she talked of
Brighton or Cheltenham a while
ago but I fancy Edinburgh will
be the place in the end - at
all events so long as her Mother
is spared to her
Now let me hear that you have
forgiven me & write to
Mrs James Hope your
congratulations on her
most fortunate wedding
div.closer:
ever affecly affectionately yours
J G Lockhart
